title: Google\Cloud\Billing\Budgets\V1\Budget
name: Budget
description:
A budget is a plan that describes what you expect to spend on Cloud projects, plus the rules to execute as spend is tracked against that plan, (for example, send an alert when 90% of the target spend is met).

The budget time period is configurable, with options such as month (default), quarter, year, or custom time period.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.billing.budgets.v1.Budget

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. Resource name of the budget. The resource name implies the scope of a budget. Values are of the form billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/budgets/{budgetId}.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: User data for display name in UI. The name must be less than or equal to 60 characters.

params.name: data.budget_filter
params.description: Optional. Filters that define which resources are used to compute the actual spend against the budget amount, such as projects, services, and the budget's time period, as well as other filters.

params.name: data.threshold_rules
params.description: Optional. Rules that trigger alerts (notifications of thresholds being crossed) when spend exceeds the specified percentages of the budget.

params.name: data.notifications_rule
params.description: Optional. Rules to apply to notifications sent based on budget spend and thresholds.

params.name: data.etag
params.description: Optional. Etag to validate that the object is unchanged for a read-modify-write operation. An empty etag will cause an update to overwrite other changes.
